name: EGR "Delight" Spray Can
description:
Actual spray can used by the artist in the creation of murals, live art and canvas works. Featured image is American Delight; the original painting was created with oil on canvas with aerosol spray paint. Each spray can is unique, from Montana to Krylon brand. Depressurized, safe for air travel.

For over a decade, Erica Balon aka EGR has passionately created artwork in oil, ink and aerosol spray paint on just about any surface you could imagine. EGR began creating editorial illustrations for Toronto's Globe and Mail and Toronto Star newspapers, and has evolved creating large scale murals and installations. Inspired by the city and it's diverse cultural, spiritual and musical influences, she discovered her love of creating live art at concerts, festivals and events the world over. Fearless in life and in art, her work often explores determination and female empowerment, as well as social themes that often challenge one's views of art in public spaces. EGR has exhibited her work in Canada's first national exhibit of street art at the Institute for Contemporary Culture at The Royal Ontario Museum; as well as the Art Gallery of Ontario, galleries, villas and boutiques worldwide.

name: "Evolution of Graffiti and Revolt" Spray Can
description:
Actual spray can used by the artist in the creation of murals, live art and canvas works. Featured image is Evolution of Graffiti and Revolt; the original painting was created with oil on canvas with aerosol spray paint. Each spray can is unique, from Montana to Krylon brand. Depressurized, safe for air travel.


For over a decade, Erica Balon aka EGR has passionately created artwork in oil, ink and aerosol spray paint on just about any surface you could imagine. EGR began creating editorial illustrations for Toronto's Globe and Mail and Toronto Star newspapers, and has evolved creating large scale murals and installations. Inspired by the city and it's diverse cultural, spiritual and musical influences, she discovered her love of creating live art at concerts, festivals and events the world over. Fearless in life and in art, her work often explores determination and female empowerment, as well as social themes that often challenge one's views of art in public spaces. EGR has exhibited her work in Canada's first national exhibit of street art at the Institute for Contemporary Culture at The Royal Ontario Museum; as well as the Art Gallery of Ontario, galleries, villas and boutiques worldwide.

name: Sleeping Beauty Print
description: Sleeping Beauty by EGR. Signed by the artist. High quality, full color print on 12pt satin cardstock, 12 x 18". Limited quantities available Limited quantities available. For nearly two decades, EGR has created artwork on just about any surface you could imagine, from canvas to concrete; challenging perceptions of public art, graffiti, and women in society, by portraying their physical power in both nature and in the city. EGR has exhibited her work in Canada's first national exhibit of street art at the Institute for Contemporary Culture at The Royal Ontario Museum; The Art Gallery of Ontario, Young Gallery, Daniels Spectrum, The Power Plant and Toronto Arts Council's gallery, as well as galleries and city walls worldwide. http://www.EGRart.com
